definition[0]: if you have seniority in a company or organization, you have worked there a long time and have some official advantages
example[0]: I had 15 years seniority, and they couldnâ€™t fire me.
definition[1]: when you are older or higher in rank than someone else
definition[2]: the fact of being older or higher in rank than someone else
example[2]: Chief judges are chosen by seniority.
definition[3]: the official advantage someone has because they have worked for an organization for a long time
example[3]: Workers with longer seniority get up to three years of benefits.
definition[4]: the situation in which particular loans etc are paid before other loans etc if a company is in financial difficulty
example[4]: Privileged creditors insisted on the seniority of their loans.
